author: crjarove
title: Support small farmers in LATAM
description: Small farmers in LATAM face many challenges such lack of education and low productivity to financial exclusion and poor access to markets.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem that this proposal raises is clear and related to the criteria of the challenge, in particular because its solution aims to create the network of small farmers based on the Cardano BlockChain and to integrate new people into this network, training on the use of new technologies. Its impact is clearly identifiable and explains not only the local contribution but also close to the European market by export of tomatoes. It is true that the direct link with the Catalyst community is not clearly stipulated, but can be deduced from the many explanations and the contribution of this solution to the Latam ecosystem of catalyst. In addition, the KPIs correspond to the challenge in the sense that it is a question of Add 30 small farmers to the network.
f6_assessments.q1: Many detailed explanations whether on the stages of the project, the information of the partners, and those of the participant are really precise, and seem to have been written with care, with the intention of a good overall understanding of this project, of its objectives and its concrete implementation. There are several links providing access to articles providing additional material, as well as references. The budget seems realistic and is also very well explained and detailed. The plan mentions the technical aspects in many facets, and the clearly stated desire to progress gradually step by step brings added value to the realistic aspects of this solution.
f6_assessments.q2: As a whole, this proposal is detailed, clear and in many ways gives an impression of transparency and reliability. The step-by-step and theme-based explanation provides an overview that is also quatifiable and therefore verifiable by the community in the KPIs indices, which seem to make sense and remain consistent. Unless I am mistaken, it is not directly stipulated that the advances of this project could be followed directly by the community, but their project of setting up a network seems to be a significant element as a means of communication.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for the comments and reading the proposal carefully, I acknowledge not having stipulated a means in which the community can follow the progress, it is something that of course will be but I admit not having mentioned it in the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: Support small farmers in Latin America proposal  fits very well with Grow Latin America, Grow Cardano very well by giving the know-how and financial inclusion knowledge to small farmers and this in turn will lead to more adoption by local farmers.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has supply chain knowledge and a farmer himself making him suitable to implement this proposal. The budget that he requested is reasonable with the majority goes towards developers and he paid the salary for himself at a humble rate. He explains the plan of action clearly. The roadmap and KPIs are for a period of one year and it is very clear why he chooses tomatoes as the first produce for a trial of project.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is more than sufficient for the community to audit his proposal progress. He knows what is need to be done and doing so with reasonable budget and timeline. It is commendable effort on what he plans to do for the small farmers and the community.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you very much for the comments, I appreciate that you have seen that the proposal presents achievable and feasible objectives and that the budget is reasonable in that sense

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has stated a clear problem with small farmers that can be solved using technology. If successful, it would bring a major impact on the local communities. It would also bring a major positive impact on Cardano, receiving into its ecosystem new members who are different from crypto's usual market(small farmers as opposed to tech nerds.) The proposal is attempting to deploy Emurgo's TRACE and Blockchain technology to create data sets, which would be highly valuable for Cardano in the future. Imagine having a real-worl, live example of traceability and financial inclusion!
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has experience as an Industrial Engineer, farmer, and entrepreneur. It is an impressive proposal but I feel it could be improved by including past achievements. This project is quite grand in scale, with the successful operation of farms on one hand(training, installation, sales, creation of network) and the creation of a dApp on the other hand. Hence, sharing proven experience in delivering such a project would be beneficial for the proposer.

The hourly rate for Emurgo developers seem low. Is it possible to get good devs at $10/hour? I am not experienced in hiring devs but I highly doubt it. What about the costs of staff who work in technology education workshops? Where would the funding for that come from? 


The reasoning above is the reason for my rating. If the proposer can clear up these details, it would strengthen what was already an impressive proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has provided a roadmap for the next 12 months after being accepted. I find it to be well thought-out, but I do not have experience in agricultural or dApp development. The KPI is also  clearly defined. However, I do see a lack of KPI on the development of the platform. How will the MVP's success be measured? Will it be gathering data on how much the farmers earn, compared to what they'd earn without the program? What features can we expect from the platform in 6 months/12 months/2 years? The proposal would greatly benefit from more details on the MVP
f6_assessments.reply:
Regarding the feasibility note.

I understand that it is a large-scale project, but I ask that this project be evaluated only for the first year where the pilot test will be carried out and create the network of farmers with only 30 of them.

For those stages I have written enough information about my skills and experience to carry them out.

Another point is that of the payment to the developers, this payment was an estimate and clarified in the proposal that would be verified with the Emurgo team, probably the hourly payment is not adequate but given the characteristics of the MVP with very basic functions, I think the budget for developers is adequate, that is, we will be able to pay more per hour but it is likely that they will use less time to develop it than what was proposed.
Regarding the staff that will work in the educational groups, it is considered at the end of the cost breakdown as "visit to farmers & operating costs"  Regarding the auditability note.

It says that there is a lack in the KPIs of the platform's MVP

How will the MVP's success be measured?

The answer: The MVP of the platform working with the planned features. what are the planned features?
They are written in the proposal: • Smart contracts with the ability to issue digital titles that represent the harvested crop.

• Transfer ownership of assets between the farmer and us.

• Share immutable asset records with customized stakeholder views.

• Integrate the COTI PAY payment processor.

What features can we expect from the platform in 6 months / 12 months / 2 years?

Add functions to the digital platform.

After the first prototype we will start adding more features to the platform, which include:

• The traceability solution from the Emurgo team.

• Creation of economic identity of farmers.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal covers a wide areas and many aspects in farming.  Working on a farmer before taking on more farmers would ensure workable solution. I strongly agree that the proposal can be effective as I see that the plan is taking one step at a time to increase its effectiveness. It also takes on the expertise in agriculture as well as explores the technology to increase the output efficiency.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal details each manageable parts that lead to overall plan.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides a clear trail of measuring the KPIs for each period so planned.

solution: Build a network of small farmers who receive technical assistance, financial services, education, tech training and access to fair markets.
experience: I´m an industrial engineer specialized in supply chain and logistics processes as well I have worked in the fields as farmer with my father
